OM_HARDWARE_VERSION.title: Mainboard Version
OM_HARDWARE_VERSION.description: Your hardware/firmware version. This corresponds to the mainboard you are using in your build.

OM_MOWER.title: Mower Model
OM_MOWER.description: The type of mower you're using. This sets physical properties like antenna position and wheel ticks per meter. Use CUSTOM for a custom mower buiold.

OM_MOWER_ESC_TYPE.title: ESC Type
OM_MOWER_ESC_TYPE.description: Select which ESC (speed controller) type you are using. Use xesc_mini if unsure.

OM_MOWER_GAMEPAD.title: Gamepad
OM_MOWER_GAMEPAD.description: Select your gamepad. The cheap ones are usually xbox360.

OM_IGNORE_CHARGING_CURRENT.title: Ignore Charging Current
OM_IGNORE_CHARGING_CURRENT.description: Set to True if you're affected by a wrong IC2 sourcing. Read here https://openmower.de/docs/versions/errata/ic2-is-wrong/ for more details

DATUM.title: Origin / Datum
DATUM.description: Set the coordinates for the robot's map origin. The only requirement is, that these are near your docking station (within a few meters).

OM_USE_NTRIP.title: Use Ntrip for receiving corrections
OM_USE_NTRIP.description: Set to False if using an external radio.

OM_NTRIP_HOSTNAME.title: NTRIP Hostname
OM_NTRIP_HOSTNAME.description: Hostname or IP of your NTRIP caster.

OM_NTRIP_RECONNECT_WAIT_SECONDS.title: NTRIP Reconnect Wait Seconds
OM_NTRIP_RECONNECT_WAIT_SECONDS.description: How long in seconds the NTRIP client waits before reconnecting

OM_NTRIP_RECONNECT_MAX.title: NTRIP Max Reconnection Attempts
OM_NTRIP_RECONNECT_MAX.description: The maximum number of times the NTRIP client retries

OM_GPS_PROTOCOL.title: GPS Protocol
OM_GPS_PROTOCOL.description: Protocol used by your GPS board. For u-blox devices use UBX, otherwise NMEA.

OM_GPS_DEVICE_TYPE.title: Device Type
OM_GPS_DEVICE_TYPE.description: Whether communicate with the serial port directly or via TCP port.

OM_USE_F9R_SENSOR_FUSION.description: Use F9R's sensor fusion. Disable, if unsure.

OM_USE_RELATIVE_POSITION.title: Use Relative Position
OM_USE_RELATIVE_POSITION.description: True, to use Relative Positioning. If you are unsure keep at false.

OM_GPS_PORT.title: Port
OM_GPS_PORT.description: Port for GPS board (/dev/...). Keep empty for default values.

OM_GPS_TCP_HOSTNAME.title: Hostname
OM_GPS_TCP_HOSTNAME.description: Hostname to read GPS data from via TCP.

OM_GPS_TCP_PORT.title: Port
OM_GPS_TCP_PORT.description: Port to read GPS data from via TCP.

OM_DOCKING_DISTANCE.title: Docking Distance
OM_DOCKING_DISTANCE.description: Distance in [m] to drive forward after docking.

OM_DOCKING_APPROACH_DISTANCE.title: Docking Approach Distance
OM_DOCKING_APPROACH_DISTANCE.description: Distance in [m] from the docking point to start docking. Has to be at least the length from the dock to your nav- or mow-area, otherwise docking will fail!

OM_DOCKING_EXTRA_TIME.description: Extra time in [s] to continue docking after voltage detection. This can be useful to make good contact with the base station. Use carefully.

OM_DOCKING_RETRY_COUNT.title: Docking retry count
OM_DOCKING_RETRY_COUNT.description: How many times to retry docking before giving up.

OM_DOCKING_REDOCK.title: Docking retry count
OM_DOCKING_REDOCK.description: Whether to attempt redocking if the voltage is no longer detected after docking.

OM_DOCKING_WAIT_TIME.title: Wait before docking
OM_DOCKING_WAIT_TIME.description: Time to wait (s) at OM_DOCKING_APPROACH_DISTANCE before starting to dock.

OM_UNDOCKING_WAIT_TIME.title: Wait before undocking
OM_UNDOCKING_WAIT_TIME.description: Time to wait in dock (s) before before starting to undock

OM_UNDOCK_DISTANCE.title: Undock Distance
OM_UNDOCK_DISTANCE.description: Distance in [m] to drive for undocking.

OM_UNDOCK_ANGLED_DISTANCE.title: Undock Angled Distance
OM_UNDOCK_ANGLED_DISTANCE.description: Distance in [m] to continue driving at an angle for undocking.

OM_UNDOCK_ANGLE.title: Undock Angle
OM_UNDOCK_ANGLE.description: Angle in degrees for second stage undocking.

OM_UNDOCK_FIXED_ANGLE.title: Undock Fixed Angle
OM_UNDOCK_FIXED_ANGLE.description: True to fix the undock angle, false to vary it.

OM_UNDOCK_USE_CURVE.title: Undock Use Curve
OM_UNDOCK_USE_CURVE.description: True to use a curved second stage, false for a straight second stage.

OM_OUTLINE_COUNT.description: How many outlines should the mover drive. It's not recommended to set this below 4.

OM_TOOL_WIDTH.title: Mowing Tool Width
OM_TOOL_WIDTH.description: Width of mowing paths in [m]. Use smaller values for more overlap.

OM_BATTERY_FULL_VOLTAGE.title: Battery Full Voltage
OM_BATTERY_FULL_VOLTAGE.description: Voltage for battery to be considered full.

OM_BATTERY_EMPTY_VOLTAGE.title: Battery Empty Voltage
OM_BATTERY_EMPTY_VOLTAGE.description: Dock if voltage remains below empty for 20s.

OM_BATTERY_CRITICAL_VOLTAGE.title: Battery Critical Voltage
OM_BATTERY_CRITICAL_VOLTAGE.description: Immediate dock if voltage is critical.

OM_MOWING_MOTOR_TEMP_HIGH.title: Mower max. Temperature
OM_MOWING_MOTOR_TEMP_HIGH.description: Motor temperature to stop mowing and wait for cooldown. This value is in deg. C.

OM_MOWING_MOTOR_TEMP_LOW.title: Mower low Temperature
OM_MOWING_MOTOR_TEMP_LOW.description: After reaching the max temperature, mowing will be paused until the mower temperature is above this value. This value is in deg. C.

OM_GPS_WAIT_TIME_SEC.title: GPS Wait Time
OM_GPS_WAIT_TIME_SEC.description: Additional wait time in [s] after undocking. Increase this value, if you get inconsistent fixes after undocking.

OM_GPS_TIMEOUT_SEC.title: GPS Timeout
OM_GPS_TIMEOUT_SEC.description: Timeout for GPS in [s]. Mowing will pause, if no GPS update was received within this configured time.

OM_ENABLE_MOWER.title: Enable Mowing Motor
OM_ENABLE_MOWER.description: Enable mowing motor. Set to false for testing.

OM_OUTLINE_OFFSET.title: Mowing Outline Offset
OM_OUTLINE_OFFSET.description: Offset to be applied to the recorded outline. Positive values move the outline inwards (i.e. safety margin).

OM_ENABLE_RECORDING_ALL.title: Enable Recording
OM_ENABLE_RECORDING_ALL.description: Set to true to record your session for debugging. Recordings will be stored in $HOME. Only enable for testing, otherwise your SD card will get full soon.

OM_SNAPSHOT_MEMORY_PER_TOPIC.title: Snapshot Buffer Memory per Topic
OM_SNAPSHOT_MEMORY_PER_TOPIC.description: Sets the maximum memory used per topic (in MB) by the Snapshot Buffer. The Snapshot Buffer stores a recent history of all messages sent, and can be dumped to disk using save_snapshot.sh. It is independent of OM_ENABLE_RECORDING

OM_SNAPSHOT_DURATION.title: Snapshot Buffer
OM_SNAPSHOT_DURATION.description: Sets the maximum age (in seconds) of messages to store in the Snapshot Buffer. The Snapshot Buffer stores a recent history of all messages sent, and can be dumped to disk using save_snapshot.sh. It is independent of OM_ENABLE_RECORDING

OM_RAIN_DELAY_MINUTES.title: Rain delay minutes
OM_RAIN_DELAY_MINUTES.description: How long to wait after rain to resume mowing when mode is "Dock Until Dry" (minimum value is 30)

OM_MOWING_ANGLE_OFFSET.description: Mowing angle offset -180 deg - +180 deg, 0 = east, -90 = north. If mowing angle offset is not absolute it gets added to the auto detected angle which is set by the first 2 m of recorded outline.

OM_MOWING_ANGLE_OFFSET_IS_ABSOLUTE.description: If mowing angle offset is absolute.

OM_MOWING_ANGLE_INCREMENT.description: The increment value will automatically add specified number of degrees to the mowing angle everytime the whole map is finished

OM_PERIMETER_SIGNAL.description: Use perimeter sensor for docking. Set to 1 or 2 depending on the signal selected on the docking station. This is only supported by Mowgli builds for now.

OM_EMERGENCY_INPUT_CONFIG.description: Comma separated list of emergency inputs (halls or stop), where each sensor can be configured in one of the following modes '[!]<I>gnore|<U>nused|<S>top|<L>Lift'

OM_EMERGENCY_LIFT_PERIOD.description: Period (ms) for >=2 wheels to be lifted in order to count as emergency (0 = disable)

OM_EMERGENCY_TILT_PERIOD.description: Period (ms) for a single wheel to be lifted in order to count as emergency (0 = disable)

OM_SHUTDOWN_ESC_MAX_PITCH.description: Maximum pitch angle (deg) where ESC shutdown is permitted (0 to disable ESC shutdown)

OM_CU_RAIN_THRESHOLD.title: Stock-CoverUI rain sensor threshold
OM_CU_RAIN_THRESHOLD.description: Stock-CoverUI limited rain sensor threshold, below which humidity/dryness value get identified as rain. As higher, as more dry. Default to 700

OM_BATTERY_CRITICAL_HIGH_VOLTAGE.title: Max. battery voltage
OM_BATTERY_CRITICAL_HIGH_VOLTAGE.description: Max. battery voltage before charging get switched off

OM_CHARGE_CRITICAL_HIGH_VOLTAGE.title: Max. charge voltage
OM_CHARGE_CRITICAL_HIGH_VOLTAGE.description: Max. charge voltage before charging get switched off

OM_CHARGE_CRITICAL_HIGH_CURRENT.title: Max. charge current
OM_CHARGE_CRITICAL_HIGH_CURRENT.description: Max. charge current before charging get switched off

external_mqtt_broker.title: External MQTT Broker
external_mqtt_broker.description: You can configure Open Mower to publish status and sensor data to your MQTT broker.

OM_MQTT_ENABLE.title: Enable MQTT Publisher
OM_MQTT_ENABLE.description: Enable publishing to the external MQTT broker.

OM_MQTT_HOSTNAME.title: MQTT Broker Hostname
OM_MQTT_HOSTNAME.description: MQTT broker hostname or IP address.

sound_settings.title: Sound Settings
sound_settings.description: For Full Sound Support read the instructions carefully. You will probably need to make hardware modifications before enabling these options.

OM_DFP_IS_5V.title: DFPlayer is set to 5V
OM_DFP_IS_5V.description: Enable if DFPlayer is set to 5V. Important: ONLY enable this, if you are sure that you have done the required modification. Otherwise you might break your Raspberry Pi Pico.

OM_LANGUAGE.description: Language as ISO-639-1 code string. This is use for sound output.

OM_VOLUME.description: Sound volume (0-100 or -1). -1 means the volume is managed by the CoverUI.

OM_BACKGROUND_SOUNDS.title: Also play background sounds
OM_BACKGROUND_SOUNDS.description: Enable if DFPlayer shall also play background-sounds (beside the informational advert sounds)

custom_environment.title: Additional Environment Variables
custom_environment.description: Click the + button to add additional environment variables. Each row is a KEY=VALUE pair and will be injected into the container.
